internal.database

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • internal.database.Table
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable

    public class Table
extends Object
implements Serializable, Cloneable
    This class implements relational database tables (including attribute names, domains and a list of tuples. Five basic relational algebra operators are provided: project, select, union, minus and join. The insert data manipulation operator is also provided. Missing are update and delete data manipulation operators.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • project

        public Table project(String attributeList)
        Project the tuples onto a lower dimension by keeping only the given attributes. Check whether the original key is included in the projection. #usage movie.project ("title year studioNo")
        Parameters:
        attributeList - the attributes to project onto
        Returns:
        the table consisting of projected tuples

      • select

        public Table select(String condition)
        Select the tuples satisfying the given condition. A condition is written as infix expression consists of 6 comparison operators: "==", "!=", "<", "<=", ">", ">=" 2 Boolean operators: "&", "|" (from high to low precedence) #usage movie.select ("1979 < year & year < 1990")
        Parameters:
        condition - the check condition for tuples
        Returns:
        the table consisting of tuples satisfying the condition

      • union

        public Table union(Table table2)
        Union this table and table2. Check that the two tables are compatible. #usage movie.union (show)
        Parameters:
        table2 - the rhs table in the union operation
        Returns:
        the table representing the union (this U table2)

      • minus

        public Table minus(Table table2)
        Take the difference of this table and table2. Check that the two tables are compatible. #usage movie.minus (show)
        Parameters:
        table2 - the rhs table in the minus operation
        Returns:
        the table representing the difference (this - table2)

      • compareTuples

        private boolean compareTuples(Comparable[] tup1,
                    Comparable[] tup2)
        Compare two tuples deeply
        Parameters:
        tup1 - the first tuple
        tup2 - the second tuple
        Returns:
        true if two arrays are equal, false if those two differ

      • join

        public Table join(String condition,
         Table table2)
        Join this table and table2. If an attribute name appears in both tables, assume it is from the first table unless it is qualified with the first letter of the second table's name (e.g., "s."). In the result, disambiguate the attribute names in a similar way (e.g., prefix the second occurrence with "s_"). Caveat: the key parameter assumes joining the table with the foreign key (this) to the table containing the primary key (table2). #usage movie.join ("studioNo == name", studio); #usage movieStar.join ("name == s.name", starsIn);
        Parameters:
        condition - the join condition for tuples
        table2 - the rhs table in the join operation
        Returns:
        the table representing the join (this |><| table2)

      • insert

        public boolean insert(Comparable[] tup)
        Insert a tuple to the table. #usage movie.insert ("'Star_Wars'", 1977, 124, "T", "Fox", 12345)
        Parameters:
        tup - the array of attribute values forming the tuple
        Returns:
        whether insertion was successful

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        whether the two tables are compatible

      • evalTup

        private boolean evalTup(String[] postfix,
              Comparable[] tup)
        Check whether the tuple satisfies the condition. Use a stack-based postfix expression evaluation algorithm.
        Parameters:
        postfix - the postfix expression for the condition
        tup - the tuple to check
        Returns:
        whether to keep the tuple

      • pack

        public byte[] pack(Comparable[] tup)
        Pack tuple tup into a record/byte-buffer (array of bytes).
        Parameters:
        tup - the array of attribute values forming the tuple
        Returns:
        a tuple packed into a record/byte-buffer

      • unpack

        public Comparable[] unpack(byte[] record)
        Unpack the record/byte-buffer (array of bytes) to reconstruct a tuple.
        Parameters:
        record - the byte-buffer in which the tuple is packed
        Returns:
        an unpacked tuple

      • tupleSize

        private int tupleSize()
        Determine the size of tuples in this table in terms of the number of bytes required to store it in a record/byte-buffer.
        Returns:
        the size of packed-tuples in bytes

      • typeCheck

        private static boolean typeCheck(Comparable[] tup,
                Class[] dom)
        Check the size of the tuple (number of elements in list) as well as the type of each value to ensure it is from the right domain.
        Parameters:
        tup - the tuple as a list of attribute values
        dom - the domains (attribute types)
        Returns:
        whether the tuple has the right size and values that comply with the given domains

      • evaluate

        private static Comparable evaluate(Comparable value1,
                  Comparable value2,
                  String operator)
        This method will take two values and apply the operator between them and return the result.
        Parameters:
        value1 - The first value
        value2 - the second value
        operator - the operator which is applied
        Returns:
        the result of value1 (operator) value2

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The operator string

      • infix2postfix

        private static String[] infix2postfix(String condition)
        Convert an untokenized infix expression to a tokenized postfix expression. This implementation does not handle parentheses ( ). Ex: "1979 < year & year < 1990" --> { "1979", "year", "<", "year", "1990", "<", "&" } "==", "!=", "<", "<=", ">", ">=" 2 Boolean operators: "&", "|" (from high to low precedence
        Parameters:
        condition - the untokenized infix condition
        Returns:
        resultant tokenized postfix expression

        private static Class[] findClass(String[] className)
        Find the classes in the "java.lang" package with given names.
        Parameters:
        className - the array of class name (e.g., {"Integer", "String"})
        Returns:
        the array of Java classes for the corresponding names

        Extract the corresponding domains from the group.
        Parameters:

        colPos - the column positions to extract
        Returns:
        the extracted domains
